GHI Engineering - 13439 // nadeem-akhtar-nu commented: ## Analysis

Issue is not reproducible.

Identified a suspicious code area where potentially, the issue could appear.

Only the value for LastRecurringScan get corrupted.

## Root Cause

### Why Only LastRecurringScan Gets Corrupted
Key Insight: Node Creation Order
The corruption pattern reveals the root cause:

```
// Line 1328: LastScan is ALWAYS written first
crmiAgent->SetServerOption(L"LastScan", timestamp);

// Lines 1330-1334: LastRecurringScan is written second (only when isRecurring=true)
if (isRecurring)
{
    crmiAgent->SetServerOption(L"LastRecurringScan", timestamp);
}
```

XML Node State Inconsistency
Why LastScan Never Corrupts:
LastScan is always the first node created for a new server
Takes the "new node" path in 
[SetServerOption](https://github.com/trilogy-group/gfi-languard/blob/89f922a52fbfd4b0cdc0eabf71fe95f2fe5c350a/Services/ScanMngSys/AgentScanManager.cpp#L1326-L1334)

Gets created cleanly as the first child element

### Why LastRecurringScan Corrupts Intermittently

First Recurring Scan: LastRecurringScan doesn't exist yet
Takes "new node" path → Gets corrupted due to CDATA bug
Explains why corruption happens
Subsequent Recurring Scans: LastRecurringScan already exists
Takes "existing node" path (line 205) → spOption->GetfirstChild()->text = value
No corruption because it bypasses the CDATA bug
The Intermittent Pattern
First time a server has a recurring scan → Corruption occurs
All subsequent recurring scans → No corruption (uses existing node path)
LastScan → Never corrupts (always first, gets created cleanly)
The Fix
The CDATA bug in lines 210-211 only affects newly created nodes:

```
// PROBLEMATIC CODE (lines 210-211):
MSXML2::IXMLDOMNodePtr spCData = m_spXMLDoc->createCDATASection(value);
spCData->text = value;  // ← This corrupts the CDATA section
```

Solution: Remove the redundant text assignment:

```
MSXML2::IXMLDOMNodePtr spCData = m_spXMLDoc->createCDATASection(value);
// Remove: spCData->text = value;
```

This explains the selective and intermittent nature of the corruption perfectly.

 ## Fix

1. Change LPCTSTR to _bstr_t at for [timestamp](https://github.com/trilogy-group/gfi-languard/blob/89f922a52fbfd4b0cdc0eabf71fe95f2fe5c350a/Services/ScanMngSys/AgentScanManager.cpp#L1327)
```
auto timestamp = (LPCTSTR)now.Format(constants.FORMAT_LastOcurrenceDate);
```

2. Split save by saving one option at a time in [SaveLastAgentScanTimestamp](https://github.com/trilogy-group/gfi-languard/blob/89f922a52fbfd4b0cdc0eabf71fe95f2fe5c350a/Services/ScanMngSys/AgentScanManager.cpp#L1302C17-L1302C43)

3. Verify the saved value by reading them again.

4. Implement a local cache for recurring scan timestamp to avoid continuous reading from file.

### Deliverables

PR: https://github.com/trilogy-group/gfi-languard/pull/3392

Installer: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/13QWugUGRmXaslqhfnyOaHkyTJ3aVvp8I

Kayako - ticket id 60166415 // Marcio Zimerman commented publicly: Hi Adam,

We cannot offer a meeting on this issue, but the steps to resolve it are straightforward:

Replace toolcfg_agent.xml in C:\ProgramData\GFI\LanGuard 12 on the affected agent with the file attached to this message. This will stop the repeated scans. The issue is caused by corruption in the <LastRecurringScan> tag.

To explain further: the LastRecurringScan value is used to track when the most recent recurring scan occurred. This allows the system to determine whether it’s time to initiate the next scheduled scan based on your recurrence settings. If that value becomes corrupted, for example, due to a failed connection during a scan or a sync issue, the agent may continue to rescan repeatedly. Fortunately, this is usually a quick fix.

Please replace the file as described and let me know if the problem persists or if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Marcio Zimerman
GFI - LanGuard Support Team
